results.description: Their shape and color change, depending on their environment and diet. There are many of them at beaches where the waves are calm.

results.name: Ambipom
results.description: It uses its tails for everything. If it wraps both of its tails around you and gives you a squeeze, that’s proof it really likes you.

results.name: Drifloon
results.description: Wandering souls gathered together to form this Pokémon. When trying to make friends with children, Drifloon grabs them by the hand.

results.name: Drifblim
results.description: The raw material for the gas inside its body is souls. When its body starts to deflate, it’s thought to carry away people and Pokémon.

results.name: Buneary
results.description: The reason it keeps one ear rolled up is so it can launch a swift counterattack if it’s attacked by an enemy.

results.name: Lopunny
results.description: It’s notably wary and has a dislike of fighting, but at the same time, it can deliver powerful kicks with its lithe legs.

results.name: Mismagius
results.description: Its muttered curses can cause awful headaches or terrifying visions that torment others.

results.name: Honchkrow
results.description: Its goons take care of most of the fighting for it. The only time it dirties its own hands is in delivering a final blow to finish off an opponent.

results.name: Glameow
results.description: When it’s happy, Glameow demonstrates beautiful movements of its tail, like a dancing ribbon.

results.name: Purugly
results.description: To make itself appear intimidatingly beefy, it tightly cinches its waist with its twin tails.

results.name: Chingling
results.description: There is an orb inside its mouth. When it hops, the orb bounces all over and makes a ringing sound.

results.name: Stunky
results.description: It protects itself by spraying a noxious fluid from its rear. The stench lingers for 24 hours.

results.name: Skuntank
results.description: It sprays a stinky fluid from its tail. The fluid smells worse the longer it is allowed to fester.

results.name: Bronzor
results.description: Implements shaped like it were discovered in ancient tombs. It is unknown if they are related.

results.name: Bronzong
results.description: Ancient people believed that petitioning Bronzong for rain was the way to make crops grow.

results.name: Bonsly
results.description: If its body gets too damp, it will die. So, in a process reminiscent of sweating, its eyes expel moisture.

results.name: Mime Jr.
results.description: When this gifted mimic surprises an opponent, Mime Jr. feels so happy that it ends up forgetting it was imitating something.

results.name: Happiny
results.description: When it sees something round and white, Happiny puts it into the pouch on its stomach. It sometimes becomes overloaded and can’t move.

results.name: Chatot
results.description: It can learn and speak human words. If they gather, they all learn the same saying.

results.name: Spiritomb
results.description: It was bound to a fissure in an odd keystone as punishment for misdeeds 500 years ago.

results.name: Gible
results.description: Its original home is an area much hotter than Alola. If you’re planning to live with one, your heating bill will soar.

results.name: Gabite
results.description: It sheds its skin and gradually grows larger. Its scales can be ground into a powder and used as raw materials for traditional medicine.

results.name: Garchomp
results.description: Its fine scales don’t just reduce wind resistance—their sharp edges also cause injury to any opponent who attacks it.

results.name: Munchlax
results.description: Anything that looks edible, Munchlax will go on and swallow whole. Its stomach is tough enough to handle it even if the food has gone rotten.

results.name: Riolu
results.description: It uses waves called auras to communicate with others of its kind. It doesn’t make any noise during this time, so its enemies can’t detect it.

results.name: Lucario
results.description: Lucario reads its opponent’s feelings with its aura waves. It finds out things it would rather not know, so it gets stressed out easily.

results.name: Hippopotas
results.description: It enshrouds itself with sand to protect itself from germs. It does not enjoy getting wet.

results.name: Hippowdon
results.description: It blasts internally stored sand from ports on its body to create a towering twister for attack.

results.name: Skorupi
results.description: It burrows under the sand to lie in wait for prey. Its tail claws can inject its prey with a savage poison.

results.name: Drapion
results.description: It has the power in its clawed arms to make scrap of a car. The tips of its claws release poison.

results.name: Croagunk
results.description: Inflating its poison sacs, it fills the area with an odd sound and hits flinching opponents with a poison jab.

results.name: Toxicroak
results.description: Its knuckle claws secrete a toxin so vile that even a scratch could prove fatal.

results.name: Carnivine
results.description: It binds itself to trees in marshes. It attracts prey with its sweet-smelling drool and gulps them down.

results.name: Finneon
results.description: It lures in prey with its shining tail fins. It stays near the surface during the day and moves to the depths when night falls.

results.name: Lumineon
results.description: They traverse the deep waters as if crawling over the seafloor. The fantastic lights of its fins shine like stars in the night sky.

results.name: Mantyke
results.description: Mantyke are friendly toward people and will approach boats closely. The patterns on their backs differ depending on their habitat.

results.name: Snover
results.description: In the spring, it grows berries with the texture of frozen treats around its belly.

results.name: Abomasnow
results.description: It lives a quiet life on mountains that are perpetually covered in snow. It hides itself by whipping up blizzards.

results.name: Weavile
results.description: Thanks to its increased intelligence, scrapping over food is a thing of the past. A scratch from its claws will give you a case of frostbite!

results.name: Magnezone
results.description: There are still people who believe that this Pokémon came from outer space. It emanates a powerful magnetic field.

prev: level up in a Magnetic Field area

results.name: Lickilicky
results.description: It uses its tongue much more skillfully than its hands or its feet. It can deftly pick up a single small bean with its tongue.

results.name: Rhyperior
results.description: It puts rocks in holes in its palms and uses its muscles to shoot them. Geodude are shot at rare times.

results.name: Tangrowth
results.description: Its vines grow so profusely that, in the warm season, you can’t even see its eyes.

results.name: Electivire
results.description: A single Electivire can provide enough electricity for all the buildings in a big city for a year.

results.name: Magmortar
results.description: Magmortar takes down its enemies by shooting fireballs, which burn them to a blackened crisp. It avoids this method when hunting prey.

results.name: Togekiss
results.description: It shares many blessings with people who respect one another’s rights and avoid needless strife.

results.name: Yanmega
results.description: This six-legged Pokémon is easily capable of transporting an adult in flight. The wings on its tail help it stay balanced.

results.name: Leafeon
results.description: It gets its nutrition from photosynthesis. It lives a quiet life deep in forests where clean rivers flow.

prev: level up near a Mossy Rock

results.name: Glaceon
results.description: It can instantaneously freeze any moisture that’s around it, creating ice pellets to shoot at its prey.

prev: level up near an Icy Rock

results.name: Gliscor
results.description: Its flight is soundless. It uses its lengthy tail to carry off its prey... Then its elongated fangs do the rest.

results.name: Mamoswine
results.description: Its impressive tusks are made of ice. The population thinned when it turned warm after the ice age.

results.name: Porygon-Z
results.description: A faulty update was added to its programming. Its behavior is noticeably strange, so the experiment may have been a failure.

results.name: Gallade
results.description: A master of courtesy and swordsmanship, it fights using extending swords on its elbows.

results.name: Probopass
results.description: It uses three small units to catch prey and battle enemies. The main body mostly just gives orders.

prev: level up in a Magnetic Field area

results.name: Dusknoir
results.description: The antenna on its head captures radio waves from the world of spirits that command it to take people there.

results.name: Froslass
results.description: It’s said that on nights of terrible blizzards, it comes down to human settlements. If you hear it knocking at your door, do not open it!

results.name: Rotom
results.description: Its body is composed of plasma. It is known to infiltrate electronic devices and wreak havoc.

results.name: Uxie
results.description: It is said that its emergence gave humans the intelligence to improve their quality of life.

results.name: Mesprit
results.description: It sleeps at the bottom of a lake. Its spirit is said to leave its body to fly on the lake’s surface.

results.name: Azelf
results.description: It is thought that Uxie, Mesprit, and Azelf all came from the same egg.

results.name: Dialga
results.description: It has the power to control time. It appears in Sinnoh-region myths as an ancient deity.

results.name: Palkia
results.description: It has the ability to distort space. It is described as a deity in Sinnoh-region mythology.

results.name: Heatran
results.description: Boiling blood, like magma, circulates through its body. It makes its dwelling place in volcanic caves.

results.name: Regigigas
results.description: There is an enduring legend that states this Pokémon towed continents with ropes.

results.name: Giratina
results.description: It was banished for its violence. It silently gazed upon the old world from the Distortion World.

results.name: Cresselia
results.description: Those who sleep holding Cresselia’s feather are assured of joyful dreams. It is said to represent the crescent moon.

results.name: Phione
results.description: It drifts in warm seas. It always returns to where it was born, no matter how far it may have drifted.

results.name: Manaphy
results.description: It starts its life with a wondrous power that permits it to bond with any kind of Pokémon.

results.name: Darkrai
results.description: It can lull people to sleep and make them dream. It is active during nights of the new moon.

results.name: Shaymin
results.description: The blooming of Gracidea flowers confers the power of flight upon it. Feelings of gratitude are the message it delivers.

results.name: Arceus
results.description: It is told in mythology that this Pokémon was born before the universe even existed.

results.name: Victini
results.description: When it shares the infinite energy it creates, that being’s entire body will be overflowing with power.

results.name: Snivy
results.description: They photosynthesize by bathing their tails in sunlight. When they are not feeling well, their tails droop.

results.name: Servine
results.description: When it gets dirty, its leaves can’t be used in photosynthesis, so it always keeps itself clean.

results.name: Serperior
results.description: It can stop its opponents’ movements with just a glare. It takes in solar energy and boosts it internally.

results.name: Tepig
results.description: It loves to eat roasted berries, but sometimes it gets too excited and burns them to a crisp.

results.name: Pignite
results.description: When its internal fire flares up, its movements grow sharper and faster. When in trouble, it emits smoke.

results.name: Emboar
results.description: It has mastered fast and powerful fighting moves. It grows a beard of fire.

results.name: Oshawott
results.description: It fights using the scalchop on its stomach. In response to an attack, it retaliates immediately by slashing.

results.name: Dewott
results.description: As a result of strict training, each Dewott learns different forms for using the scalchops.

results.name: Samurott
results.description: One swing of the sword incorporated in its armor can fell an opponent. A simple glare from one of them quiets everybody.

results.name: Patrat
results.description: Extremely cautious, one of them will always be on the lookout, but it won’t notice a foe coming from behind.

results.name: Watchog
results.description: When they see an enemy, their tails stand high, and they spit the seeds of berries stored in their cheek pouches.

results.name: Lillipup
results.description: This Pokémon is popular with beginners because it’s intelligent, obedient to its Trainer’s commands, and easy to raise.

results.name: Herdier
results.description: It has been living with people for so long that portrayals of it can be found on the walls of caves from long, long ago.

results.name: Stoutland
results.description: Its fur is long and thick. A long time ago in cold regions, every household kept a Stoutland.

results.name: Purrloin
results.description: They steal from people for fun, but their victims can’t help but forgive them. Their deceptively cute act is perfect.

results.name: Liepard
results.description: Stealthily, it sneaks up on its target, striking from behind before its victim has a chance to react.

results.name: Pansage
results.description: It’s good at finding berries and gathers them from all over. It’s kind enough to share them with friends.

results.name: Simisage
results.description: Ill tempered, it fights by swinging its barbed tail around wildly. The leaf growing on its head is very bitter.

results.name: Pansear
results.description: This Pokémon lives in caves in volcanoes. The fire within the tuft on its head can reach 600 degrees Fahrenheit.

results.name: Simisear
results.description: When it gets excited, embers rise from its head and tail and it gets hot. For some reason, it loves sweets.

results.name: Panpour
results.description: The water stored inside the tuft on its head is full of nutrients. Plants that receive its water grow large.

results.name: Simipour
results.description: It prefers places with clean water. When its tuft runs low, it replenishes it by siphoning up water with its tail.

results.name: Munna
results.description: It eats the dreams of people and Pokémon. When it eats a pleasant dream, it expels pink-colored mist.

results.name: Musharna
results.description: The dream mist coming from its forehead changes into many different colors depending on the dream that was eaten.

results.name: Pidove
results.description: These Pokémon live in cities. They are accustomed to people. Flocks often gather in parks and plazas.

results.name: Tranquill
results.description: No matter where in the world it goes, it knows where its nest is, so it never gets separated from its Trainer.

results.name: Unfezant
results.description: Males have plumage on their heads. They will never let themselves feel close to anyone other than their Trainers.

results.name: Blitzle
results.description: Its mane shines when it discharges electricity. They use the frequency and rhythm of these flashes to communicate.

results.name: Zebstrika
results.description: They have lightning-like movements. When Zebstrika run at full speed, the sound of thunder reverberates.

results.name: Roggenrola
results.description: It was found in a fissure in a layer of exposed rock. The material that makes up its body is dirt from several hundred years ago.

results.name: Boldore
results.description: Its orange crystals are lumps of powerful energy. They’re valuable, so Boldore is sometimes targeted for them.

results.name: Gigalith
results.description: It absorbs rays of sunlight and shoots out energy. It’s usually lurking deep beneath the surface.

results.name: Woobat
results.description: The heart-shaped mark left on a body after a Woobat has been attached to it is said to bring good fortune.

results.name: Swoobat
results.description: Anyone who comes into contact with the ultrasonic waves emitted by a courting male experiences a positive mood shift.

results.name: Drilbur
results.description: By spinning its body, it can dig straight through the ground at a speed of 30 mph.

results.name: Excadrill
results.description: More than 300 feet below the surface, they build mazelike nests. Their activity can be destructive to subway tunnels.

results.name: Audino
results.description: It touches others with the feelers on its ears, using the sound of their heartbeats to tell how they are feeling.

results.name: Timburr
results.description: Always carrying squared logs, they help out with construction. As they grow, they carry bigger logs.

results.name: Gurdurr
results.description: This Pokémon is so muscular and strongly built that even a group of wrestlers could not make it budge an inch.

results.name: Conkeldurr
results.description: Rather than rely on force, they master moves that utilize the centrifugal force of spinning concrete.

results.name: Tympole
results.description: By vibrating its cheeks, it emits sound waves imperceptible to humans. It uses the rhythm of these sounds to talk.

results.name: Palpitoad
results.description: It lives in the water and on land. It uses its long, sticky tongue to immobilize its opponents.

results.name: Seismitoad
results.description: They shoot paralyzing liquid from their head bumps. They use vibration to hurt their opponents.

results.name: Throh
results.description: When it encounters a foe bigger than itself, it wants to throw it. It changes belts as it gets stronger.

results.name: Sawk
results.description: Tying their belts gets them pumped and makes their punches more destructive. Disturbing their training angers them.

results.name: Sewaddle
results.description: Since this Pokémon makes its own clothes out of leaves, it is a popular mascot for fashion designers.

results.name: Swadloon
results.description: It protects itself from the cold by wrapping up in leaves. It stays on the move, eating leaves in forests.

results.name: Leavanny
results.description: It keeps its eggs warm with heat from fermenting leaves. It also uses leaves to make warm wrappings for Sewaddle.

results.name: Venipede
results.description: Its bite injects a potent poison, enough to paralyze large bird Pokémon that try to prey on it.

results.name: Whirlipede
results.description: It is usually motionless, but when attacked, it rotates at high speed and then crashes into its opponent.

results.name: Scolipede
results.description: With quick movements, it chases down its foes, attacking relentlessly with its horns until it prevails.

results.name: Cottonee
results.description: When attacked, it expels cotton from its body to create a diversion. The cotton it loses grows back in quickly.

results.name: Whimsicott
results.description: Whimsicott doesn’t live in a fixed location. It floats around on whirling winds, appearing all over the place to perform its mischief.

results.name: Petilil
results.description: They prefer clean water and soil. When the environment they live in turns bad, the whole bunch will up and move to a new area.

results.name: Lilligant
results.description: It’s well liked by other Pokémon because of its beauty. The flower on its head needs constant care, or it will soon wither and rot.

results.name: Basculin
results.description: When a school of Basculin appears in a lake, everything else disappears, except for Corphish and Crawdaunt. That’s how violent Basculin are.

results.name: Sandile
results.description: Sandile’s still not good at hunting, so it mostly eats things that have collapsed in the desert. It’s called “the cleaner of the desert.”

results.name: Krokorok
results.description: It buries some of its prey in the sand to use as emergency meals when its hunts are unsuccessful.

results.name: Krookodile
results.description: It conceals itself in sandstorms that Flygon whip up and waits patiently for prey to appear.

results.name: Darumaka
results.description: When it sleeps, it pulls its limbs into its body and its internal fire goes down to 1,100 degrees Fahrenheit.

results.name: Darmanitan
results.description: Its internal fire burns at 2,500 degrees Fahrenheit, making enough power that it can destroy a dump truck with one punch.

results.name: Maractus
results.description: Arid regions are their habitat. They move rhythmically, making a sound similar to maracas.

results.name: Dwebble
results.description: When it finds a stone of a suitable size, it secretes a liquid from its mouth to open up a hole to crawl into.

results.name: Crustle
results.description: Competing for territory, Crustle fight viciously. The one whose boulder is broken is the loser of the battle.

results.name: Scraggy
results.description: It stretches its saggy skin up to its neck to protect itself. The saggier their skin, the more respect they garner.

results.name: Scrafty
results.description: It taunts its opponents by spitting. It has a certain territory that it never leaves its whole life long.

results.name: Sigilyph
results.description: The guardians of an ancient city, they always fly the same route while keeping watch for invaders.

results.name: Yamask
results.description: Each of them carries a mask that used to be its face when it was human. Sometimes they look at it and cry.

results.name: Cofagrigus
results.description: Grave robbers who mistake them for real coffins and get too close end up trapped inside their bodies.

results.name: Tirtouga
results.description: Its hunting grounds encompassed a broad area, from the land to more than half a mile deep in the ocean.

results.name: Carracosta
results.description: Carracosta eats every last bit of the prey it catches, even the shells and bones, to further strengthen its sturdy shell.

results.name: Archen
results.description: Restored from a fossil, this ancient bird Pokémon has wings but can’t yet fly.

results.name: Archeops
results.description: Said to be an ancestor of bird Pokémon, the muscles it uses to flap its wings are still weak, so it needs a long runway in order to take off.

results.name: Trubbish
results.description: If a young Pokémon or child breathes in the toxic gas that Trubbish belches out, it could be a life-threatening situation.

results.name: Garbodor
results.description: Some say the reason Garbodor in Alola are a little stronger than their counterparts elsewhere is the presence of Muk, their natural enemy.

results.name: Zorua
results.description: If a normally talkative child suddenly stops talking, it may have been replaced by Zorua.

results.name: Zoroark
results.description: If it thinks humans are going to discover its den, Zoroark shows them visions that make them wander around in the woods.

results.name: Minccino
results.description: When its tail has gotten dirty from self-cleaning or from cleaning its nest, Minccino spends a whole day washing its tail in clean spring water.

results.name: Cinccino
results.description: The oil that seeps from its body is really smooth. For people troubled by bad skin, this oil is an effective treatment.

results.name: Gothita
results.description: They intently observe both Trainers and Pokémon. Apparently, they are looking at something that only Gothita can see.

results.name: Gothorita
results.description: According to many old tales, it creates friends for itself by controlling sleeping children on starry nights.

results.name: Gothitelle
results.description: They can predict the future from the placement and movement of the stars. They can see Trainers’ life spans.

results.name: Solosis
results.description: They drive away attackers by unleashing psychic power. They can use telepathy to talk with others.

results.name: Duosion
results.description: When their two divided brains think the same thoughts, their psychic power is maximized.

results.name: Reuniclus
results.description: When Reuniclus shake hands, a network forms between their brains, increasing their psychic power.

results.name: Ducklett
results.description: They are better at swimming than flying, and they happily eat their favorite food, peat moss, as they dive underwater.

results.name: Swanna
results.description: Swanna start to dance at dusk. The one dancing in the middle is the leader of the flock.

results.name: Vanillite
results.description: When the morning sun hit an icicle, it wished not to melt, and thus Vanillite was born. At night, it buries itself in snow to sleep.

results.name: Vanillish
results.description: This hearty Pokémon survived the Ice Age. It’s incredibly popular in very hot regions.

results.name: Vanilluxe
results.description: Vanilluxe is born when two Vanillish, half-melted by the day’s light, stick to each other and freeze together in the cold return of night.

results.name: Deerling
results.description: The turning of the seasons changes the color and scent of this Pokémon’s fur. People use it to mark the seasons.

results.name: Sawsbuck
results.description: They migrate according to the seasons, so some people call Sawsbuck the harbingers of spring.

results.name: Emolga
results.description: As it flies, it scatters electricity around, so bird Pokémon keep their distance. That’s why Emolga can keep all its food to itself.

results.name: Karrablast
results.description: For some reason they evolve when they receive electrical energy while they are attacking Shelmet.

results.name: Escavalier
results.description: These Pokémon evolve by wearing the shell covering of a Shelmet. The steel armor protects their whole body.

results.name: Foongus
results.description: It lures Pokémon with its pattern that looks just like a Poké Ball, then releases poison spores.

results.name: Amoonguss
results.description: It lures prey close by dancing and waving its arm caps, which resemble Poké Balls, in a swaying motion.

results.name: Frillish
results.description: Using the invisible poison spikes on its veillike arms and legs, it paralyzes its enemies and causes them to drown.

results.name: Jellicent
results.description: Fishermen are terrified of Jellicent. It’s rumored to drag them into the sea and steal their lives away.

results.name: Alomomola
results.description: The reason it helps Pokémon in a weakened condition is that any Pokémon coming after them may also attack Alomomola.

results.name: Joltik
results.description: They attach themselves to large-bodied Pokémon and absorb static electricity, which they store in an electric pouch.

results.name: Galvantula
results.description: When attacked, they create an electric barrier by spitting out many electrically charged threads.

results.name: Ferroseed
results.description: It absorbs the iron it finds in the rock while clinging to the ceiling. It shoots spikes when in danger.

results.name: Ferrothorn
results.description: They attach themselves to cave ceilings, firing steel spikes at targets passing beneath them.

results.name: Klink
results.description: The two minigears that mesh together are predetermined. Each will rebound from other minigears without meshing.

results.name: Klang
results.description: A minigear and big gear comprise its body. If the minigear it launches at a foe doesn’t return, it will die.

results.name: Klinklang
results.description: Its red core functions as an energy tank. It fires the charged energy through its spikes into an area.

results.name: Tynamo
results.description: One alone can emit only a trickle of electricity, so a group of them gathers to unleash a powerful electric shock.

results.name: Eelektrik
results.description: These Pokémon have a big appetite. When they spot their prey, they attack it and paralyze it with electricity.

results.name: Eelektross
results.description: They crawl out of the ocean using their arms. They will attack prey on shore and immediately drag it into the ocean.

results.name: Elgyem
results.description: This Pokémon is shrouded in mystery. It’s said to have appeared from a UFO that fell from the sky about 50 years ago.

results.name: Beheeyem
results.description: It has strong psychic powers. Using its fingers that flash three different colors, it controls its opponents and rewrites their memories.

results.name: Litwick
results.description: Litwick shines a light that absorbs the life energy of people and Pokémon, which becomes the fuel that it burns.

results.name: Lampent
results.description: It arrives near the moment of death and steals spirit from the body.

results.name: Chandelure
results.description: The spirits burned up in its ominous flame lose their way and wander this world forever.

results.name: Axew
results.description: They mark their territory by leaving gashes in trees with their tusks. If a tusk breaks, a new one grows in quickly.

results.name: Fraxure
results.description: A broken tusk will not grow back, so it diligently sharpens its tusks on river rocks after the end of a battle.

results.name: Haxorus
results.description: Their sturdy tusks will stay sharp even if used to cut steel beams. These Pokémon are covered in hard armor.

results.name: Cubchoo
results.description: Their snot is a barometer of health. When healthy, their snot is sticky and the power of their ice moves increases.

results.name: Beartic
results.description: It freezes its breath to create fangs and claws of ice to fight with. Cold northern areas are its habitat.

results.name: Cryogonal
results.description: They are composed of ice crystals. They capture prey with chains of ice, freezing the prey at -148 degrees Fahrenheit.

results.name: Shelmet
results.description: It evolves when bathed in an electric-like energy along with Karrablast. The reason is still unknown.

results.name: Accelgor
results.description: When its body dries out, it weakens. So, to prevent dehydration, it wraps itself in many layers of thin membrane.

results.name: Stunfisk
results.description: It conceals itself in the mud of the seashore. Then it waits. When prey touch it, it delivers a jolt of electricity.

results.name: Mienfoo
results.description: They seclude themselves in the mountains and devote themselves to training. The form of their kicks and chops differs from pack to pack.

results.name: Mienshao
results.description: When Mienshao lets out a bizarre wail, you’re in danger. A flurry of kicks and chops too fast to see is about to be unleashed!

results.name: Druddigon
results.description: It infiltrates tunnels that Pokémon like Diglett and Dugtrio have dug and quietly waits for prey to pass through.

results.name: Golett
results.description: Although ancient people apparently built it by working with clay, the source of its energy is unclear.

results.name: Golurk
results.description: When the seal on its chest is removed, it rages indiscriminately, turning the whole town around it into a mountain of rubble.

results.name: Pawniard
results.description: It follows Bisharp’s orders to a tee when it attacks enemies. After slashing an opponent, Pawniard clangs both of its blades together.

results.name: Bisharp
results.description: It leads a group of Pawniard. Bisharp doesn’t even change its expression when it deals the finishing blow to an opponent.

results.name: Bouffalant
results.description: Their fluffy fur absorbs damage, even if they strike foes with a fierce headbutt.

results.name: Rufflet
results.description: Known as a natural-born warrior, soon after its hatching, it will challenge its parent to a fight in order to gain their acceptance.

results.name: Braviary
results.description: Known as “the hero of the skies,” this Pokémon is so proud and so brave that it will never retreat, even when it’s injured.

results.name: Vullaby
results.description: Its healthy appetite leads to visible growth spurts. It often has to replace the bones it wears as its size increases.

results.name: Mandibuzz
results.description: It’s always searching for food for Vullaby. When it finds a weak Pokémon, Mandibuzz swoops it right off to its nest.

results.name: Heatmor
results.description: It draws in air through its tail, transforms it into fire, and uses it like a tongue. It melts Durant and eats them.

results.name: Durant
results.description: They attack in groups, covering themselves in steel armor to protect themselves from Heatmor.

results.name: Deino
results.description: Lacking sight, it’s unaware of its surroundings, so it bumps into things and eats anything that moves.

results.name: Zweilous
results.description: After it has eaten up all the food in its territory, it moves to another area. Its two heads do not get along.

results.name: Hydreigon
results.description: It responds to movement by attacking. This scary, three-headed Pokémon devours everything in its path!

results.name: Larvesta
results.description: It protects itself with flame. Long years ago, people believed Larvesta had a nest on the sun.

results.name: Volcarona
results.description: According to legends, it was hatched from a flaming cocoon to save people and Pokémon that were suffering from the cold.

results.name: Cobalion
results.description: It has a body and heart of steel. It worked with its allies to punish people when they hurt Pokémon.

results.name: Terrakion
results.description: Spoken of in legend, this Pokémon used its phenomenal power to destroy a castle in its effort to protect Pokémon.

results.name: Virizion
results.description: Legends say this Pokémon confounded opponents with its swift movements.

results.name: Tornadus
results.description: Tornadus expels massive energy from its tail, causing severe storms. Its power is great enough to blow houses away.

results.name: Thundurus
results.description: As it flies around, it shoots lightning all over the place and causes forest fires. It is therefore disliked.

results.name: Reshiram
results.description: When Reshiram’s tail flares, the heat energy moves the atmosphere and changes the world’s weather.

results.name: Zekrom
results.description: Concealing itself in lightning clouds, it flies throughout the Unova region. It creates electricity in its tail.

results.name: Landorus
results.description: From the forces of lightning and wind, it creates energy to give nutrients to the soil and make the land abundant.

results.name: Kyurem
results.description: It generates a powerful, freezing energy inside itself, but its body became frozen when the energy leaked out.

results.name: Keldeo
results.description: When it is resolute, its body fills with power and it becomes swifter. Its jumps are then too fast to follow.

results.name: Meloetta
results.description: Its melodies are sung with a special vocalization method that can control the feelings of those who hear it.

results.name: Genesect
results.description: This Pokémon existed 300 million years ago. Team Plasma altered it and attached a cannon to its back.

results.name: Chespin
results.description: Such a thick shell of wood covers its head and back that even a direct hit from a truck wouldn’t faze it.

results.name: Quilladin
results.description: They strengthen their lower bodies by running into one another. They are very kind and won’t start fights.

results.name: Chesnaught
results.description: When it takes a defensive posture with its fists guarding its face, it could withstand a bomb blast.

results.name: Fennekin
results.description: As it walks, it munches on a twig in place of a snack. It intimidates opponents by puffing hot air out of its ears.

results.name: Braixen
results.description: When the twig is plucked from its tail, friction sets the twig alight. The flame is used to send signals to its allies.

results.name: Delphox
results.description: Using psychic power, it generates a fiery vortex of 5,400 degrees Fahrenheit, incinerating foes swept into this whirl of flame.

results.name: Froakie
results.description: It protects its skin by covering its body in delicate bubbles. Beneath its happy-go-lucky air, it keeps a watchful eye on its surroundings.

results.name: Frogadier
results.description: Its swiftness is unparalleled. It can scale a tower of more than 2,000 feet in a minute’s time.

results.name: Greninja
results.description: It appears and vanishes with a ninja’s grace. It toys with its enemies using swift movements, while slicing them with throwing stars of sharpest water.

results.name: Bunnelby
results.description: It has ears like shovels. Digging holes strengthens its ears so much that they can sever thick roots effortlessly.

results.name: Diggersby
results.description: As powerful as an excavator, its ears can reduce dense bedrock to rubble. When it’s finished digging, it lounges lazily.

results.name: Fletchling
results.description: Its body is always warm. Trainers who live in cold areas apparently sleep with it in their bed.

results.name: Fletchinder
results.description: Its speed right after takeoff already puts it in the top speed class of all bird Pokémon.

results.name: Talonflame
results.description: Bird Pokémon make up most of its diet. It approaches at high speeds and smacks them down to the ground with its powerful kick.

results.name: Scatterbug
results.description: The powder that covers its body regulates its temperature, so it can live in any region or climate.

results.name: Spewpa
results.description: The beaks of bird Pokémon can’t begin to scratch its stalwart body. To defend itself, it spews powder.

results.name: Vivillon
results.description: The patterns on this Pokémon’s wings depend on the climate and topography of its habitat. It scatters colorful scales.

results.name: Litleo
results.description: This hot-blooded Pokémon is filled with curiosity. When it gets angry or starts fighting, its short mane gets hot.

results.name: Pyroar
results.description: The temperature of its breath is over 10,000 degrees Fahrenheit, but Pyroar doesn’t use it on its prey. This Pokémon prefers to eat raw meat.

results.name: Flabébé
results.description: Flabébé wears a crown made from pollen it’s collected from its flower. The crown has hidden healing properties.

results.name: Floette
results.description: It gives its own power to flowers, pouring its heart into caring for them. Floette never forgives anyone who messes up a flower bed.

results.name: Florges
results.description: Its life can span several hundred years. It’s said to devote its entire life to protecting gardens.

results.name: Skiddo
results.description: If it has sunshine and water, it doesn’t need to eat, because it can generate energy from the leaves on its back.

results.name: Gogoat
results.description: They inhabit mountainous regions. The leader of the herd is decided by a battle of clashing horns.

results.name: Pancham
results.description: It’s desperate to intimidate its opponents. Be nice and pretend to be scared if you catch it glaring at you intensely.

next: Level 32, Dark type Pokémon in party

results.name: Pangoro
results.description: Pangoro is the type to talk with its fists. It doesn’t say much as it pummels opponents with enough force to send a dump truck flying.

prev: Level 32, Dark type Pokémon in party

results.name: Furfrou
results.description: Left alone, its fur will grow longer and longer, but it will only allow someone it trusts to cut it.

results.name: Espurr
results.description: It has enough psychic energy to blast everything within 300 feet of itself, but it has no control over its power.

results.name: Meowstic
results.description: The eyeball patterns on the interior of its ears emit psychic energy. It keeps the patterns tightly covered because that power is too immense.

results.name: Honedge
results.description: If anyone dares to grab its hilt, it wraps a blue cloth around that person’s arm and drains that person’s life energy completely.

results.name: Doublade
results.description: The complex attack patterns of its two swords are unstoppable, even for an opponent greatly accomplished at swordplay.

results.name: Aegislash
results.description: Apparently, it can detect the innate qualities of leadership. According to legend, whoever it recognizes is destined to become king.

results.name: Spritzee
results.description: In the past, rather than using perfume, royal ladies carried a Spritzee that would waft a fragrance they liked.

results.name: Aromatisse
results.description: Its scent is so overpowering that, unless a Trainer happens to really enjoy the smell, he or she will have a hard time walking alongside it.

results.name: Swirlix
results.description: Because it eats nothing but sweets, its fur is as sticky sweet as cotton candy.

results.name: Slurpuff
results.description: Its sense of smell is 100 million times better than a human’s, so even the faintest scent tells it about everything in the area. It’s like it can see with its nose!

results.name: Inkay
results.description: When exchanging information with others of its kind, it flashes the light-emitting spots on its body in a complex rhythm.

results.name: Malamar
results.description: It flashes the pattern on its torso to control its prey and draw them in. The edges of its fins are supremely sharp.

results.name: Binacle
results.description: They stretch and then contract, yanking their rocks along with them in bold hops. They eat seaweed that washes up on the shoreline.

results.name: Barbaracle
results.description: Barbaracle’s legs and hands have minds of their own, and they will move independently. But they usually follow the head’s orders.

results.name: Skrelp
results.description: It’s not good at swimming, so it clings to the seaweed. In the Alola region, it’s often found near Dhelmise.

results.name: Dragalge
results.description: It blends in with seaweed to ambush its prey and then takes them down with a poisonous liquid strong enough to melt metal.

results.name: Clauncher
results.description: It moves around by jetting water from its right pincer. It has a poor sense of balance, so it’s terrible at swimming straight.

results.name: Clawitzer
results.description: Its right arm is packed with meat. When its pincer falls off, it’s exported to be used as a cooking ingredient.

results.name: Helioptile
results.description: The frills on either side of its head have cells that generate electricity when exposed to sunlight.

results.name: Heliolisk
results.description: It stimulates its muscles with electricity, boosting the strength in its legs and enabling it to run 100 yards in five seconds.

results.name: Tyrunt
results.description: Tyrunt is spoiled and selfish. It may just be trying to frolic, but sometimes the ones it’s trying to frolic with are gravely injured.

results.name: Tyrantrum
results.description: The king of the ancient world, it can easily crunch a car with the devastating strength of its enormous jaws.

results.name: Amaura
results.description: Amaura was restored successfully, but it’s not expected to live long because of the heat of the current environment.

results.name: Aurorus
results.description: This usually quiet and kindly Pokémon has a surface temperature of around –240 degrees Fahrenheit.

results.name: Sylveon
results.description: Sylveon wraps its ribbonlike feelers around its Trainer’s arm because this touch enables it to read its Trainer’s feelings.

results.name: Hawlucha
results.description: In combat, Hawlucha leaps nimbly about, taking advantage of its opponents’ blind spots. It’s also skilled at using superb submission holds.

results.name: Dedenne
results.description: Its upper whiskers are sensors that survey its surroundings. Its lower whiskers are organs that shoot electricity.

results.name: Carbink
results.description: To keep the jewels on their bodies free of tarnish, packs of Carbink use their soft manes to polish one another’s jewels.

results.name: Goomy
results.description: Its body is mostly water. If it dries out, it will die, so it’s always sitting with perfect stillness in the shade.

results.name: Sliggoo
results.description: Its entire body is covered with gooey mucus that can dissolve anything. Be sure to put gloves on if you’re going to touch it.

results.name: Goodra
results.description: Underneath its slimy skin is a thick layer of fat, and the combination of the two makes enemies’ attacks slide right off.

results.name: Klefki
results.description: Long ago it lived in mines, but once the minerals that make up its diet became scarcer, Klefki began appearing in human settlements.

results.name: Phantump
results.description: An unknown spirit came to lodge in a tree stump, creating this Pokémon. A cure-all can be made from an infusion of its green leaves.

results.name: Trevenant
results.description: This Pokémon controls trees via roots stretching from its feet, and it will attack anyone that dares to ravage the forest.

results.name: Pumpkaboo
results.description: It is said to carry wandering spirits to the place where they belong so they can move on.

results.name: Gourgeist
results.description: It enwraps its prey in its hairlike arms. It sings joyfully as it observes the suffering of its prey.

results.name: Bergmite
results.description: Using air of -150 degrees Fahrenheit, they freeze opponents solid. They live in herds above the snow line on mountains.

results.name: Avalugg
results.description: The way several Bergmite huddle on its back makes it look like an aircraft carrier made of ice.

results.name: Noibat
results.description: It flies around in search of fruit to eat. It uses ultrasonic waves to detect which fruits are ripe.

results.name: Noivern
results.description: This hot-blooded Pokémon attacks anything it sees with ultrasonic waves that can crush boulders.

results.name: Xerneas
results.description: When the horns on its head shine in seven colors, it is said to be sharing everlasting life.

results.name: Yveltal
results.description: When its life comes to an end, it absorbs the life energy of every living thing and turns into a cocoon once more.

results.name: Zygarde
results.description: Some say it can change to an even more powerful form when battling those who threaten the ecosystem.

results.name: Diancie
results.description: It can instantly create many diamonds by compressing the carbon in the air between its hands.

results.name: Hoopa
results.description: It is said to be able to seize anything it desires with its six rings and six huge arms. With its power sealed, it is transformed into a much smaller form.

results.name: Volcanion
results.description: It expels its internal steam from the arms on its back. It has enough power to blow away a mountain.

results.name: Rowlet
results.description: It feels relaxed in tight, dark places and has been known to use its Trainer’s pocket or bag as a nest.

results.name: Dartrix
results.description: Supremely sensitive to the presence of others, it can detect opponents standing behind it, flinging its sharp feathers to take them out.

results.name: Decidueye
results.description: Decidueye can nock and fire an arrow at an enemy in a tenth of a second, so its battles are decided in the blink of an eye.

results.name: Litten
results.description: Its coat regrows twice a year. When the time comes, Litten sets its own body on fire and burns away the old fur.

results.name: Torracat
results.description: When its mane is standing on end, you can tell it’s feeling good. When it isn’t feeling well, its fur will lie down flat.

results.name: Incineroar
results.description: When its fighting spirit is set alight, the flames around its waist become especially intense.

results.name: Popplio
results.description: Popplio gets on top of its bouncy water balloons to jump higher. It’s quite the acrobatic fighter!

results.name: Brionne
results.description: It attacks by smacking its enemies with the exploding water balloons that it creates.

results.name: Primarina
results.description: Also known as a songstress, it has a fantastical look on moonlit nights when it leads its colony in song.

results.name: Pikipek
results.description: It may look spindly, but its neck muscles are heavy-duty. It can peck at a tree 16 times per second!

results.name: Trumbeak
results.description: From its mouth, it fires the seeds of berries it has eaten. The scattered seeds give rise to new plants.

results.name: Toucannon
results.description: Known for forming harmonious couples, this Pokémon is brought to wedding ceremonies as a good luck charm.

results.name: Yungoos
results.description: Although it will eat anything, it prefers fresh living things, so it marches down streets in search of prey.

results.name: Gumshoos
results.description: Patient by nature, this Pokémon loses control of itself and pounces when it spots its favorite meal—Rattata!

results.name: Grubbin
results.description: It spits a sticky thread to stop opponents in their tracks, and then it grabs them in its sharp, sturdy mandibles to take them down.

results.name: Charjabug
results.description: Its stout shell provides excellent defense from attacks. It uses electricity on persistent opponents.

next: Level up in a Magnetic Field area

results.name: Vikavolt
results.description: Vikavolt flusters opponents with acrobatic flying maneuvers. This creates an opening for it to deliver an electric beam attack.

prev: use Thunder Stone, in Gen 8, or level up in a Magnetic Field area

results.name: Crabrawler
results.description: Crabrawler has been known to mistake Exeggutor for a coconut tree and climb it. The enraged Exeggutor shakes it off and stomps it.

results.name: Crabominable
results.description: Before it stops to think, it just starts pummeling. There are records of its turning back avalanches with a flurry of punches.

results.name: Oricorio
results.description: This Oricorio has drunk red nectar. If its Trainer gives the wrong order, this passionate Pokémon becomes fiercely angry.

results.name: Cutiefly
results.description: Cutiefly can pick up the auras of living things. It skillfully reads those auras to predict its foes’ movements and make fools of them.

results.name: Ribombee
results.description: It can predict the weather from moisture levels and wind direction. Ribombee only reveals itself when there are a few clear days in a row.

results.name: Rockruff
results.description: When it rubs the rocks on its neck against you, that’s proof of its love for you. However, the rocks are sharp, so the gesture is quite painful!

results.name: Lycanroc
results.description: The rocks in its mane are sharper than a knife. Fragments that break off are treasured as good luck charms.

results.name: Wishiwashi
results.description: When it’s in a jam, its shining eyes attract others of its kind. The light from its eyes is visible almost 25 miles away.

results.name: Mareanie
results.description: Aside from its head, its body parts regenerate quickly if they’re cut off. After a good night’s sleep, Mareanie is back to normal.

results.name: Toxapex
results.description: With its 12 legs, it creates a dome to shelter within. The flow of the tides doesn’t affect Toxapex in there, so it’s very comfortable.

results.name: Mudbray
results.description: Possessing mighty power, Mudbray can be loaded with 50 times its own body weight and will be totally fine.

results.name: Mudsdale
results.description: It can trudge mountain roads without rest for three days and three nights, all the while dragging a 10-ton load.

results.name: Dewpider
results.description: It can only breathe oxygen that has dissolved in water, so it wears a water bubble on its head when it walks around on land.

results.name: Araquanid
results.description: It has a habit of storing things it values in its water bubble. If its Trainer doesn’t watch out, Araquanid will try to put them in its bubble!

results.name: Fomantis
results.description: It loves the sunshine. When it basks in the sunlight regularly, it grows up with vivid coloration.

results.name: Lurantis
results.description: As it slashes into its enemies, it looks like it’s dancing. Its elegant appearance has led some to call it the most glamorous Grass Pokémon.

results.name: Morelull
results.description: It likes damp dark places. When night falls, the spores filling the caps of its mushrooms glow.

results.name: Shiinotic
results.description: When it starts fighting for territory with Parasect, the entire area gets completely coated in spores!

results.name: Salandit
results.description: It weakens opponents and sends them reeling with its poisonous gas. Salandit doesn’t deal well with Spinda, since it’s always reeling.

results.name: Salazzle
results.description: It punishes Salandit that couldn’t bring it food with a fierce slap of its flame-spewing palm.

results.name: Stufful
results.description: Stufful hates to be hugged or touched in any way. It will squirm, thrash, and resist with amazing power.

results.name: Bewear
results.description: It boasts tremendous physical strength. Many people call it the most dangerous Pokémon in the Alola region.

results.name: Bounsweet
results.description: It tries to resist being swallowed by a bird Pokémon by spinning the sepals on its head. It’s usually a fruitless attempt.

results.name: Steenee
results.description: It bounces around, swinging the sepals on its head with abandon. They’re quite painful when they smack you!

results.name: Tsareena
results.description: A Pokémon with an aggressive personality and a mastery of kicking, it cackles every time it kicks an opponent.

results.name: Comfey
results.description: It picks flowers and sticks them to its body with fluids it produces. The aroma that wafts from its petals has a healing effect.

results.name: Oranguru
results.description: Oranguru don’t get along with each other, so they’re always engaging in battles of wits to decide which one is superior.

results.name: Passimian
results.description: Berries are its weapons as well as the staple of its diet. The one that can throw a berry the farthest is the boss of the troop.

results.name: Wimpod
results.description: An astonishingly cowardly Pokémon, Wimpod will whir its legs at high speeds to run away if anything comes near it.

results.name: Golisopod
results.description: Its claws, which it can extend and retract at will, are its greatest weapons. Golisopod is sometimes accompanied by Wimpod.

results.name: Sandygast
results.description: If you build sand mounds when you’re playing, destroy them before you go home, or they may get possessed and become Sandygast.

results.name: Palossand
results.description: Once it has whipped up a sandstorm to halt its opponents in their tracks, this terrifying Pokémon snatches away their vitality.

results.name: Pyukumuku
results.description: Its entire body is covered in its own slime. If you accidentally step on one, you’ll slip, and it will get mad and smack you!

results.name: Type: Null
results.description: There’s danger of its going on a rampage, so its true power is sealed away beneath its control mask.

results.name: Silvally
results.description: Through the bond it formed with its Trainer, its will was strengthened, and it was able to destroy its control mask.

results.name: Minior
results.description: Although its outer shell is uncommonly durable, the shock of falling to the ground smashes the shell to smithereens.

results.name: Komala
results.description: It remains asleep from birth to death as a result of the sedative properties of the leaves that form its diet.

results.name: Turtonator
results.description: Its exploding shell poses a real danger but is sensitive to moisture. On rainy days, Turtonator takes silent refuge in caves.

results.name: Togedemaru
results.description: Its capacity to produce electricity is somewhat limited, so it gets charged up by letting lightning strike it!

results.name: Mimikyu
results.description: A gust of wind revealed what hides under this Pokémon’s rag to a passing Trainer, who went home and died painfully that very night.

results.name: Bruxish
results.description: Its skin is thick enough to fend off Mareanie’s spikes. With its robust teeth, Bruxish crunches up the spikes and eats them.

results.name: Drampa
results.description: It appears in towns and plays with the children. Drampa will protect kids when they’re in danger, so their moms don’t have to worry.

results.name: Dhelmise
results.description: Its chain-like green seaweed can stretch outward for hundreds of yards. For some reason, it gets along well with Skrelp.

results.name: Jangmo-o
results.description: It will never show an enemy its back in battle. Ancient warriors liked Jangmo-o for its valiant disposition and made it one of their own.

results.name: Hakamo-o
results.description: The scales it sheds can be molded and processed to make pots and pans. They conduct heat well, so they’re a popular item.

results.name: Kommo-o
results.description: It battles valiantly with its fists, which are armored in steel scales. Kommo-o specializes in uppercuts.

results.name: Tapu Koko
results.description: The lightning-wielding guardian deity of Melemele, Tapu Koko is brimming with curiosity and appears before people from time to time.

results.name: Tapu Lele
results.description: Although called a guardian deity, Tapu Lele is devoid of guilt about its cruel disposition and can be described as nature incarnate.

results.name: Tapu Bulu
results.description: It makes ringing sounds with its tail to let others know where it is, avoiding unneeded conflicts. This guardian deity of Ula’ula controls plants.

results.name: Tapu Fini
results.description: Although it’s called a guardian deity, terrible calamities sometimes befall those who recklessly approach Tapu Fini.

results.name: Cosmog
results.description: Whether or not it’s a Pokémon from this world is a mystery. When it’s in a jam, it warps away to a safe place to hide.

results.name: Cosmoem
results.description: As it absorbs light, Cosmoem continues to grow. Its golden shell is surprisingly solid.

next: Level 53, in Pokémon Sun or Ultra Sun
Level 53, in Pokémon Sun or Ultra Sun

results.name: Solgaleo
results.description: In writings from the distant past, it’s called by the name “the beast that devours the sun.”

prev: Level 53, in Pokémon Sun or Ultra Sun

results.name: Lunala
results.description: It sometimes summons unknown powers and life-forms here to this world from holes that lead to other worlds.

prev: Level 53, in Pokémon Moon or Ultra Moon

results.name: Nihilego
results.description: It appeared in this world from an Ultra Wormhole. Nihilego appears to be a parasite that lives by feeding on people and Pokémon.

results.name: Buzzwole
results.description: Buzzwole goes around showing off its abnormally swollen muscles. It is one kind of Ultra Beast.

results.name: Pheromosa
results.description: Although it’s alien to this world and a danger here, it’s apparently a common organism in the world where it normally lives.

results.name: Xurkitree
results.description: They’ve been dubbed Ultra Beasts. Some of them stand unmoving, like trees, with their arms and legs stuck into the ground.

results.name: Celesteela
results.description: Although it’s alien to this world and a danger here, it’s apparently a common organism in the world where it normally lives.

results.name: Kartana
results.description: Although it’s alien to this world and a danger here, it’s apparently a common organism in the world where it normally lives.

results.name: Guzzlord
results.description: An unknown life-form called a UB. It may be constantly hungry—it is certainly always devouring something.

results.name: Necrozma
results.description: Light is the source of its energy. If it isn’t devouring light, impurities build up in it and on it, and Necrozma darkens and stops moving.

results.name: Magearna
results.description: Built roughly 500 years ago by a scientist, the part called the Soul-Heart is the actual life-form.

results.name: Marshadow
results.description: It sinks into the shadows of people and Pokémon, where it can understand their feelings and copy their capabilities.

results.name: Poipole
results.description: An Ultra Beast that lives in a different world, it cackles wildly as it sprays its opponents with poison from the needles on its head.

results.name: Naganadel
results.description: One kind of Ultra Beast, it fires a glowing, venomous liquid from its needles. This liquid is also immensely adhesive.

results.name: Stakataka
results.description: When stone walls started moving and attacking, the brute’s true identity was this mysterious life-form, which brings to mind an Ultra Beast.

results.name: Blacephalon
results.description: A UB that appeared from an Ultra Wormhole, it causes explosions, then takes advantage of opponents’ surprise to rob them of their vitality.

results.name: Zeraora
results.description: It approaches its enemies at the speed of lightning, then tears them limb from limb with its sharp claws.

results.name: Meltan
results.description: They live as a group, but when the time comes, one strong Meltan will absorb all the others and evolve.

results.name: Melmetal
results.description: Centrifugal force is behind the punches of Melmetal's heavy hex-nut arms. Melmetal is said to deliver the strongest punches of all Pokémon.

results.name: Grookey
results.description: It attacks with rapid beats of its stick. As it strikes with amazing speed, it gets more and more pumped.

results.name: Thwackey
results.description: When it’s drumming out rapid beats in battle, it gets so caught up in the rhythm that it won’t even notice that it’s already knocked out its opponent.

results.name: Rillaboom
results.description: The one with the best drumming techniques becomes the boss of the troop. It has a gentle disposition and values harmony among its group.

results.name: Scorbunny
results.description: It has special pads on the backs of its feet, and one on its nose. Once it’s raring to fight, these pads radiate tremendous heat.

results.name: Raboot
results.description: It kicks berries right off the branches of trees and then juggles them with its feet, practicing its footwork.

results.name: Cinderace
results.description: It’s skilled at both offense and defense, and it gets pumped up when cheered on. But if it starts showboating, it could put itself in a tough spot.

results.name: Sobble
results.description: When it gets wet, its skin changes color, and this Pokémon becomes invisible as if it were camouflaged.

results.name: Drizzile
results.description: Highly intelligent but also very lazy, it keeps enemies out of its territory by laying traps everywhere.

results.name: Inteleon
results.description: Its nictitating membranes let it pick out foes’ weak points so it can precisely blast them with water that shoots from its fingertips at Mach 3.

results.name: Skwovet
results.description: It eats berries nonstop—a habit that has made it more resilient than it looks. It’ll show up on farms, searching for yet more berries.

results.name: Greedent
results.description: Common throughout the Galar region, this Pokémon has strong teeth and can chew through the toughest of berry shells.

results.name: Rookidee
results.description: Jumping nimbly about, this small-bodied Pokémon takes advantage of even the slightest opportunity to disorient larger opponents.

results.name: Corvisquire
results.description: The lessons of many harsh battles have taught it how to accurately judge an opponent’s strength.

results.name: Corviknight
results.description: With their great intellect and flying skills, these Pokémon very successfully act as the Galar region’s airborne taxi service.

results.name: Blipbug
results.description: Often found in gardens, this Pokémon has hairs on its body that it uses to assess its surroundings.

results.name: Dottler
results.description: As it grows inside its shell, it uses its psychic abilities to monitor the outside world and prepare for evolution.

results.name: Orbeetle
results.description: It emits psychic energy to observe and study what’s around it—and what’s around it can include things over six miles away.

results.name: Nickit
results.description: Cunning and cautious, this Pokémon survives by stealing food from others. It erases its tracks with swipes of its tail as it makes off with its plunder.

results.name: Thievul
results.description: With a lithe body and sharp claws, it goes around stealing food and eggs. Boltund is its natural enemy.

results.name: Gossifleur
results.description: It whirls around in the wind while singing a joyous song. This delightful display has charmed many into raising this Pokémon.

results.name: Eldegoss
results.description: The cotton on the head of this Pokémon can be spun into a glossy, gorgeous yarn—a Galar regional specialty.

results.name: Wooloo
results.description: If its fleece grows too long, Wooloo won’t be able to move. Cloth made with the wool of this Pokémon is surprisingly strong.

results.name: Dubwool
results.description: Its majestic horns are meant only to impress the opposite gender. They never see use in battle.

results.name: Chewtle
results.description: It starts off battles by attacking with its rock-hard horn, but as soon as the opponent flinches, this Pokémon bites down and never lets go.

results.name: Drednaw
results.description: This Pokémon rapidly extends its retractable neck to sink its sharp fangs into distant enemies and take them down.

results.name: Yamper
results.description: This gluttonous Pokémon only assists people with their work because it wants treats. As it runs, it crackles with electricity.

results.name: Boltund
results.description: It sends electricity through its legs to boost their strength. Running at top speed, it easily breaks 50 mph.

results.name: Rolycoly
results.description: It can race around like a unicycle, even on rough, rocky terrain. Burning coal sustains it.

results.name: Carkol
results.description: By rapidly rolling its legs, it can travel at over 18 mph. The temperature of the flames it breathes exceeds 1,800 degrees Fahrenheit.

results.name: Coalossal
results.description: While it’s engaged in battle, its mountain of coal will burn bright red, sending off sparks that scorch the surrounding area.

results.name: Applin
results.description: As soon as it’s born, it burrows into an apple. Not only does the apple serve as its food source, but the flavor of the fruit determines its evolution.

results.name: Flapple
results.description: It flies on wings of apple skin and spits a powerful acid. It can also change its shape into that of an apple.

results.name: Appletun
results.description: Its body is covered in sweet nectar, and the skin on its back is especially yummy. Children used to have it as a snack.

results.name: Silicobra
results.description: It spews sand from its nostrils. While the enemy is blinded, it burrows into the ground to hide.

results.name: Sandaconda
results.description: Its unique style of coiling allows it to blast sand out of its sand sac more efficiently.

results.name: Cramorant
results.description: This hungry Pokémon swallows Arrokuda whole. Occasionally, it makes a mistake and tries to swallow a Pokémon other than its preferred prey.

results.name: Arrokuda
results.description: After it’s eaten its fill, its movements become extremely sluggish. That’s when Cramorant swallows it up.

results.name: Barraskewda
results.description: It spins its tail fins to propel itself, surging forward at speeds of over 100 knots before ramming prey and spearing into them.

results.name: Toxel
results.description: It manipulates the chemical makeup of its poison to produce electricity. The voltage is weak, but it can cause a tingling paralysis.

results.name: Toxtricity
results.description: This short-tempered and aggressive Pokémon chugs stagnant water to absorb any toxins it might contain.

results.name: Sizzlipede
results.description: It wraps prey up with its heated body, cooking them in its coils. Once they’re well-done, it will voraciously nibble them down to the last morsel.

results.name: Centiskorch
results.description: While its burning body is already dangerous on its own, this excessively hostile Pokémon also has large and very sharp fangs.

results.name: Clobbopus
results.description: Its tentacles tear off easily, but it isn’t alarmed when that happens—it knows they’ll grow back. It’s about as smart as a three-year-old.

results.name: Grapploct
results.description: Searching for an opponent to test its skills against, it emerges onto land. Once the battle is over, it returns to the sea.

results.name: Sinistea
results.description: The teacup in which this Pokémon makes its home is a famous piece of antique tableware. Many forgeries are in circulation.

results.name: Polteageist
results.description: Leaving leftover black tea unattended is asking for this Pokémon to come along and pour itself into it, turning the tea into a new Polteageist.

results.name: Hatenna
results.description: If this Pokémon senses a strong emotion, it will run away as fast as it can. It prefers areas without people.

results.name: Hattrem
results.description: Using the braids on its head, it pummels foes to get them to quiet down. One blow from those braids would knock out a professional boxer.

results.name: Hatterene
results.description: If you’re too loud around it, you risk being torn apart by the claws on its tentacle. This Pokémon is also known as the Forest Witch.

results.name: Impidimp
results.description: It sneaks into people’s homes, stealing things and feasting on the negative energy of the frustrated occupants.

results.name: Morgrem
results.description: With sly cunning, it tries to lure people into the woods. Some believe it to have the power to make crops grow.

results.name: Grimmsnarl
results.description: Its hairs work like muscle fibers. When its hairs unfurl, they latch on to opponents, ensnaring them as tentacles would.

results.name: Obstagoon
results.description: It evolved after experiencing numerous fights. While crossing its arms, it lets out a shout that would make any opponent flinch.

results.name: Perrserker
results.description: After many battles, it evolved dangerous claws that come together to form daggers when extended.

results.name: Cursola
results.description: Be cautious of the ectoplasmic body surrounding its soul. You’ll become stiff as stone if you touch it.

results.name: Sirfetch'd
results.description: After deflecting attacks with its hard leaf shield, it strikes back with its sharp leek stalk. The leek stalk is both weapon and food.

prev: achieve 3 critical hits in one battle

results.name: Mr. Rime
results.description: Its amusing movements make it very popular. It releases its psychic power from the pattern on its belly.

results.name: Runerigus
results.description: Never touch its shadowlike body, or you’ll be shown the horrific memories behind the picture carved into it.

results.name: Milcery
results.description: They say that any patisserie visited by Milcery is guaranteed success and good fortune.

results.name: Alcremie
results.description: When Alcremie is content, the cream it secretes from its hands becomes sweeter and richer.

results.name: Falinks
results.description: The six of them work together as one Pokémon. Teamwork is also their battle strategy, and they constantly change their formation as they fight.

results.name: Pincurchin
results.description: It stores electricity in each spine. Even if one gets broken off, it still continues to emit electricity for at least three hours.

results.name: Snom
results.description: It eats snow that piles up on the ground. The more snow it eats, the bigger and more impressive the spikes on its back grow.

results.name: Frosmoth
results.description: It shows no mercy to any who desecrate fields and mountains. It will fly around on its icy wings, causing a blizzard to chase offenders away.

results.name: Stonjourner
results.description: Once a year, on a specific date and at a specific time, they gather out of nowhere and form up in a circle.

results.name: Eiscue
results.description: This Pokémon keeps its heat-sensitive head cool with ice. It fishes for its food, dangling its single hair into the sea to lure in prey.

results.name: Indeedee
results.description: Through its horns, it can pick up on the emotions of creatures around it. Positive emotions are the source of its strength.

results.name: Morpeko
results.description: It carries electrically roasted seeds with it as if they’re precious treasures. No matter how much it eats, it always gets hungry again in short order.

results.name: Cufant
results.description: If a job requires serious strength, this Pokémon will excel at it. Its copper body tarnishes in the rain, turning a vibrant green color.

results.name: Copperajah
results.description: These Pokémon live in herds. Their trunks have incredible grip strength, strong enough to crush giant rocks into powder.

results.name: Dracozolt
results.description: The powerful muscles in its tail generate its electricity. Compared to its lower body, its upper half is entirely too small.

results.name: Arctozolt
results.description: This Pokémon lived on prehistoric seashores and was able to preserve food with the ice on its body. It went extinct because it moved so slowly.

results.name: Dracovish
results.description: Its mighty legs are capable of running at speeds exceeding 40 mph, but this Pokémon can’t breathe unless it’s underwater.

results.name: Arctovish
results.description: The skin on its face is impervious to attack, but breathing difficulties made this Pokémon go extinct anyway.

results.name: Duraludon
results.description: The special metal that composes its body is very light, so this Pokémon has considerable agility. It lives in caves because it dislikes the rain.

results.name: Dreepy
results.description: If this weak Pokémon is by itself, a mere child could defeat it. But if Dreepy has friends to help it train, it can evolve and become much stronger.

results.name: Drakloak
results.description: Without a Dreepy to place on its head and care for, it gets so uneasy it’ll try to substitute any Pokémon it finds for the missing Dreepy.

results.name: Dragapult
results.description: Apparently the Dreepy inside Dragapult’s horns eagerly look forward to being launched out at Mach speeds.

results.name: Zacian
results.description: This Pokémon has slumbered for many years. Some say it’s Zamazenta’s elder sister—others say the two Pokémon are rivals.

results.name: Zamazenta
results.description: This Pokémon slept for aeons while in the form of a statue. It was asleep for so long, people forgot that it ever existed.

results.name: Eternatus
results.description: It was inside a meteorite that fell 20,000 years ago. There seems to be a connection between this Pokémon and the Dynamax phenomenon.

results.name: Kubfu
results.description: If Kubfu pulls the long white hair on its head, its fighting spirit heightens and power wells up from the depths of its belly.

results.name: Urshifu
results.description: Inhabiting the mountains of a distant region, this Pokémon races across sheer cliffs, training its legs and refining its moves.

results.name: Zarude
results.description: Once the vines on Zarude’s body tear off, they become nutrients in the soil. This helps the plants of the forest grow.

results.name: Regieleki
results.description: Its entire body is made up of a single organ that generates electrical energy. Regieleki is capable of creating all Galar’s electricity.

results.name: Regidrago
results.description: Its body is composed of crystallized dragon energy. Regidrago is said to have the powers of every dragon Pokémon.

results.name: Glastrier
results.description: Glastrier has tremendous physical strength, and the mask of ice covering its face is 100 times harder than diamond.

results.name: Spectrier
results.description: As it dashes through the night, Spectrier absorbs the life-force of sleeping creatures. It craves silence and solitude.

results.name: Calyrex
results.description: Calyrex is known in legend as a king that ruled over Galar in ancient times. It has the power to cause hearts to mend and plants to spring forth.
